title: How to Make a CD Hovercraft
category_hierarchy: CD and Vinyl Record Craft Projects

steps.headline: Preheat the glue gun to the desired temperature setting.
Check the plastic pullout bottle cap by aligning to center hole of the CD making sure it fits.
steps.description: Once you know it fits, remove it.

steps.headline: Apply the hot glue on the ring around the water bottle cap.
Quickly align and  firmly press the cap against the center hole of the CD.
Hold the cap against the CD until the glue cools down and hardens.
Stretch the mouth of the balloon over the water bottle cap attached to the CD.
Pull the pullout cap outward on the bottle cap while holding the balloon in place.
Flip the CD over and blow underneath the cap to inflate the balloon.
Close the cap to seal the air inside the balloon.
Place the hovercraft on a flat surface.
steps.description: Then pull out the water bottle cap.

steps.headline: Move the hovercraft.
steps.description: It should take very little force. When the balloon deflates, inflate it again to repeat the process.

text: Preheat the glue gun to the desired temperature setting. Then insert the glue stick. Check the plastic pullout bottle cap by aligning to center hole of the CD making sure it fits. Once you know it fits, remove it. Apply the hot glue on the ring around the water bottle cap.  Quickly align and  firmly press the cap against the center hole of the CD.  Hold the cap against the CD until the glue cools down and hardens.  Stretch the mouth of the balloon over the water bottle cap attached to the CD.  Pull the pullout cap outward on the bottle cap while holding the balloon in place.  Flip the CD over and blow underneath the cap to inflate the balloon.  Close the cap to seal the air inside the balloon.  Place the hovercraft on a flat surface. Then pull out the water bottle cap. Move the hovercraft. It should take very little force. When the balloon deflates, inflate it again to repeat the process.
